title: Stack Downloads
content: I typically download 30 to 40 video files daily of around 5 MB each. The most I can download seems to be 8 files, then I have to select the next 8 to download. Is there a way I can select all 30 files and have them download one at a time in order without having to keep selecting the next file?
creator: john.parrington

title: CERTIFICADO DIGITAL NO DEJA USARLO
content: Hola, no me deja usar el certificado. Siempre iba bien hasta hora, el otro día reinstalé el navegador y funcionaba, en cuanto apagué el pc y volví a abrir el navegador ya no me deja usar otra vez el certificado, da error al procesar la solicitud en cualquier web que lo necesito. Sin embargo desde el Opera va perfecto pero quiero usar este navegador que lo tengo todo configurado, es el que estoy de usar. Un saludo
creator: viryi_asturianita

title: Compatibility Issue with Mozilla Firefox: E-commerce Website Rendering Errors
content:
I am facing a perplexing issue while using the Mozilla Firefox browser to access a my e-commerce website. It seems that the website's pages are not rendering correctly, resulting in distorted images, misplaced text, and overall compromised user experience. I have tested the website on other browsers, and it functions flawlessly. This leads me to believe that there might be a compatibility issue specific to Mozilla Firefox.

I have cleared my cache, disabled extensions, and ensured that my browser is up to date, but the problem persists. Has anyone else experienced a similar issue or can offer guidance on how to troubleshoot and resolve this compatibility hiccup with Mozilla Firefox? Your assistance would be greatly appreciated. Here is the site URL
creator: jongore219

title: Firefox browser window resets...
content:
After reinstalling Windows 11 Pro on a newly installed SSD my browser resets location and size to default. Nothing listed here in support or found elsewhere through a web search has made a difference. Also, if I leave Firefox open for an extended period of time so that the browser stays where I put it, and keeps the same size, it will crash. As a test, I had Windows resize the browser to the full monitor, closed it, and when I reopened Firefox it filled the monitor. A second time closed and reopened a few minutes later resets back to default location and size. Everything else (bookmarks, extensions, etc.) remains the same. Nothing has been added or removed since the fresh install.

This is the latest version, 23H2, of Windows 11 Pro, which, btw, was the version I was running before the fresh install of Windows 11 Pro.

How can this be corrected?

Thanks.
creator: cmcole101

title: Cannot paste images into WhatsApp on desktop in Firefox browser
content: I saw there was a fix / workaround for pasting text into WhatsApp on desktop in Firefox, but I used to be able to copy and paste images too and that still doesn't work. It works in the AVG secure browser though. It used to work in Chrome, but I don't want to go to Chrome just to send a picture from my desktop. Is there any workaround or fix in Firefox to copy and paste images into WhatsApp on desktop?
creator: wendy33

title: cannot prevent search bar from going to url bar / address bar in private browsing mode
content:
I have an issue with the address bar in private windows. Normally when you click on the search bar in the new tab page, it will redirect the cursor to the address bar instead of letting you use the search bar.

I found the following solution on the forum here that works for normal windows: go to the about:config page and set browser.newtabpage.activity-stream.improvesearch.handoffToAwesomebar to false.

For private windows, this fix does not work. It will still go to the address bar instead of letting you use the search bar. Is there another way for me to fix this so that it will also work in private windows?
creator: babhi.eff.19

title: Firefox Connection is blocked through AVG secure VPN
content:
For the past few weeks (perhaps after updates?), my Firefox browser has refused to connect through AVG secure VPN - it is completely blocked and time-out on ALL websites. When I disconnect the AVG VPN, then Firefox works immediately correctly. It happens on both private and public networks.

Both Firefox and AVG secure VPN are up to date. Firefox 120.0 (64- bit) AVG Secure VPN 5.28.9117 I have been using AVG professional antivirus and firewall for years. Windows 10 Latest Version.

Any suggestions please?
creator: christiaan5

title: Sponsored Content on New Tab
content: I often see a Shortcut on my New Tab that I have never gone to, which says "sponsored" on it. I do not want these ads. I have looked up the answer: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/sponsor-privacy?as=u&utm_source=inproduct I can manually delete a sponsored shortcut once, but this does not stop them from coming onto future New Tabs. My problem is, the long-term answer simply does not work. Settings -> Home -> Firefox Home Content simply does not contain a section that says "Sponsored shortcuts" and therefore this solution is not accessable. I am on Version 120 as suggested. What is going wrong? How do I prevent these ads from appearing on the New Tab page?
creator: stephenwaffles

title: Firefox Browser
